intro: Helianthermum oelandicum var. canescens, commonly known as the silverleaf helianthemum, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is a member of the rockrose family (Cistaceae) and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage due to dense pubescence. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
